pros: Great career path, good benefits
cons: Need to overtime, quite stressful in certain department

pros: Great working culture, employee benefits and great career growth
cons: high turnover rate due to the intensive stress level

pros: Good medical benefits and perks
cons: Long working hours, stringent management

review_title: Good Career prospect and decent pay
pros: Good Career prospect and decent pay and bonus can be really good if performance is within management expectations
cons: Management tends to micro manage

pros: nice co-worker, nice canteen, young talent
cons: strict management style, co-worker quite old

pros: Good colleague, good environment, attractive bonus
cons: Location would be better, old facilities

pros: Great incentives. Work life balanced.
cons: Not enough training or support were giving to new comers

pros: Good employer, loyal and supportive
cons: Process and procedures can be an overload

pros: it is a good job
cons: no comments from my side

pros: - Learn a lot of new things
cons: - Stress level is high

pros: Great company to work for. Passionate and friendly coworkers. I was an intern for 2 months and both my coworkers and manager were extremely helpful.
cons: The team organization could be improved a little bit. When I was there our team had 2 interns, but the analysts still did most of the work. Few would ask us to do something if we hadn't take the initiative.

job_title: Management Trainee in Indian Land, SC
pros: High-committed management team, strive for business and people success. Promising career development initiatives including on-going internal / external training for staff.
cons: Long working hours and parking are major issue if you based in Masjid Jamek.

pros: Supportive management and well structured corporate
cons: No work life balance and overwork

pros: People are generally quite nice
cons:
Long working hours
A lot of internal reportings 
Tedious and non value added tasks/ work

pros: Good company and good to work with colleague
cons: No career progression at all

pros: very friendly people, very positive environment
cons: not much, work stress but i guess every work place has its own stress

pros: happy and good experience in there
cons: low salary and the increment is also low

pros: The people in the department are nice
cons: Unclear future career path on what positions you might take in the future

review_title: Overall a very old school company
pros: Job stability and accessible with public transport.
cons: management is traditional and close minded.

job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Kuala Lumpur
pros: Stable and solid as a rock
cons: Dated office and can be more conducive

pros: most of the senior are willing to teach and give advice to junior
cons: work overtime , cannot have work life balance

review_title: bank allows employees to learn and grow
pros: full range of products which could gain experience
cons: mainly focused in Asia with limited branches in US and Europe. Regional exposure is emphasized

pros: Rapport are built in Team
cons: There could be improvement in work life balance

pros: Good exposure with good platform
cons: No rooms for any promotion

pros: Good people. Rare Internship opportunity at Front Desk.
cons: May not learn a lot

pros: china coverage, growing regional presence, stable management
cons: still some time to go before established presence

pros: Learn a lot of things
cons: Work load a lot and hectic

pros: Once World strongest bank, very liberal organization culture
cons: limited branch network, very stringent lending rules

pros: Colleagues are friendly, compliance culture is strong, many learning opportunities if willing to learn
cons: The company's emphasis on hiring and rewarding 'leaders' leads to increasing number of talkers and freeloaders in management ('Working through Others'). Professional skills and knowledge are not valued (for a department of Compliance professionals and lawyers!), only 'leadership' is. Employees who actually do work are looked down upon ('leaders do not do BAU') and under-rewarded. Unnecessary processes and procedures are instructed by 'leaders' to show 'leadership' ('Do the Same Things Differently'). Highest management in department is incompetent. Holding on to power through political manipulations, empty talks and spinning the latest management directives into catchwords for their own benefits. Genuine feedback to management are dismissed, at best. Capable employees are side-lined leading to brain-drain.

pros:
training, job interviews and trainers are very helpful and nice. They really care.
Creative and innovative, fast moving, transparent
igorous process of screening and interviewing candidates but do this in a warm and friendly manner that helps you feel at ease. They really focus on your talents and personality when assessing if you are culturally fitting to the ethos of the company and the interview questions feel more like a conversation than an interrogation which I'm sure many of us have had to face in the past.
cons:
salary, lack of flexible time. Long work day while in training.Long hours, stressful in time
the business should be expanded to different sector in the future.

pros: The best reasons will be that OCBC is a foreign bank in China and the "prestige" associated with working in a foreign bank comes in the form of better opportunities. Being labelled as a former OCBC employee increases your market value instantly  and increases the chances of being head hunted. It is a good place to start for graduates in China because it is so short handed that you dive straight into work without much formal training. My colleague was able to produce regulatory reports single handedly even though she was just an undergraduate on an internship with OCBC. Opportunities or Threat?
cons:
The downsides of working at OCBC Bank really depends on one's personal preferences and working style. Not to mention, the department you are in. Hierachy is obvious and it is not suited for you if you're seeking a workplace where you are treated according to your dedication and contribution, not your salary and rank. 
Moreover, many expatriates from Singapore and Hong Kong with huge compensation and benefit packages while the locals with MBA get peanuts.

job_title: Personal Financial Advisor in Petaling Jaya
pros:
- staff benefits (insurance, flex$ plan)
- nice work environment (generally all ocbc branches have fixed interiors)
- the initial training prepares you physically for the branch
- you will be mentally prepared and challenged but this helps you grow as a fresh grad
cons:
- even though it is preferred that english is your main language, if you're working in kuala lumpur or selangor in general, cantonese is much preferred. 
- you MIGHT not get the same treatment, respect or mentor ship as other colleagues of your batch, or younger because this will be based on your banca / unit trust sales and NOT how you service your customers. 
- weekend banking is not stated in the contract but is highly encouraged to participate in weekend banking in fear of not being a team player.

review_title: A lot of opportunity to grow
job_title: Assistant Vice President in Kuala Lumpur
pros:
Encourage promote from within and internal job rotation among department. Good exposure for staff and open up to new things. A good staff retention program too.
A lot of cross-functional or cross-border project for process improvement.
cons:
Always expect you to do more with less. The reason is always cost cutting. But there are things that you will have to spend first before you can see the saving.

It is a great experience to be involved in project, however the sad part is nobody will relief your daily task, means you have to do project as well as complete your daily work too.

pros: People here know their stuff and are willing to teach - if you make the effort to know them. Bosses (depending on their age group) are understanding and are genuine, pushes you for exponential growth.
cons: Bosses who have been working there forever are reluctant to change status quo, sometimes only changing when it is a little too late. Needs improvement technology wise - OCBC HQ in Singapore senior management does not really take the time to know the people in OCBC Malaysia. Career progression depends on longevity and luck sometimes, as they believe wisdom comes with age, instead of with tenacity and willingness to learn.

review_title: Good working environment but need to be prepared to work till your last breath
pros: Been with the same department for more than 5 years because of the people here. Managed to find true friends, some helpful colleagues and supervisors at work to keep me motivated. I would say office politics is very mild here =)
cons: The Operations division is always about taking extra projects or tasks to get better compensation package. Doing very good in your job function only isn't gonna get you good bonus. They will want to squeeze you dry to your very last drop before they reward you. Worklife balance is all just nonsense talk by the management.

pros:
- Helpful colleagues and direct supervisors
- Great training  (I guess?) 
- Tools to support on sales (If time frame allows) 
- As long as you have great and consistent result, fast promotion is definitely going your way
- Highly Compliance
cons:
- Work life balance is not a thing in branch environment, too many meeting and briefing before and after standard working hours 
- Result oriented and number oriented
- Top management's statement could be so harsh to make you feel pathetic about yourself 
- A complete sales process takes too much time 
- Highly Compliance (sometimes cause bad customer's experience)

pros:
- Great / Compassionate supervisors
- Ample learning opportunities
- Good balance between an 'aggresive' organization (in terms of business) and balacing the need to be a caring, understanding employer.
cons:
- Fair bit of red tape to get things done
- Being a subsidiary (MY), to run fast, matrix reporting to HO and the 'earnesty' of HO to standardize everything to the micro levels of management are encumbering the ability to be nimble and the whole idea of empowerment is somewhat lost. 
- Pay could be better for the mid managers - talents are lost because of better salary pull elsewhere

pros: Can't think of any so far. Strategic location of the company?
cons:
-Very poor variable bonus and long working hour. No work life balance. 
-Below market employee benefits e.g dental, medical, optical, performance bonus. No contractual bonus as well. 
-Less employee engagement activities to spice up employees other than work only 
-Managers expect you to work 24x7 as you will always receive their emails/texts from time to time 
-A lot of red tapes and unnecessary processes. Very strict policies and procedures which make it harder to work. 
-Turnover rate very high compared to other Banks

review_title: The superiors are very aggressive because its all about SALES.
pros: Colleagues are great! Benefits are not bad, medical, higher EPF rates, high sales commission
cons: No personal table but shared long table (exactly like how customer service works), a lot of pressures from superior, always meeting, necessary to travel, have to work overtime after working hour or on weekends WITHOUT claim (No OT)

pros: Stable, and relatively relaxed working environment. Iron rice bowl for many looking to settle down in a bank. A place to just cruise through till a better offer appears.
cons: Lousy compensation for sales people. Bureaucratic with incumbent senior bankers running the show. Close-minded mentality, antiquated business strategies, and lack of respect towards employees. Not ideal if you're looking to make some good money.

review_title: Handling inbound for enquiries pertaining on the OCBC’s product and deliver good rapport with customer as the bank
pros: Great place to learn how to deal with customer in call and how to manage self confidence as well as teach you how to manage the cases within time frame.Also have a good support from management from training until on the job.
cons: Heavy job load also required follow up not in just one call.Manage the feedback that customer issued on daily basis as well as now company currently focus more on sales hence the target sales system implemented in kpi calculations.

review_title: Fair exposure to credit operations in a local bank as an intern, however the processes in place needs some modernization
pros:
Good employee benefits - snacks, bubble tea every month, leave by 5 on a Friday each month
Nice colleagues who are willing to teach, when they are not busy with their own work
cons: As an intern, no proper structure in place for speed learning/ training, which is important given the short 3-month internship period.

job_title: Loan Operations Intern in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Great opportunity to learn about wholesale lending

Small office allows for interaction with upper management as well as colleagues

Standard 9-5 working hours
cons:
Due to OCBC's small presence in the U.S, Career advancement is limited

Sometimes there isn't much to do as an intern.

Would definitely need to stay longer to get a better grasp in the whole lending cycle

pros:
Good training ground for fresh graduates
Senior managers are approachable and they have interest in staff welfare.
Co-workers in other departments are easy to work with.
cons:
Not much scope for career development for middle level professionals.
Lots of overtime even for those working in a non-operational unit/divison
Lots of work has to be done manual - no standard systems or software
Minimal increment

review_title: Career advancement and salary not satisfactory, or on par with industry
pros: Good company reputation compared to the other local banks. No retrenchment during financial crisis. Reasonably standard leave and medical benefits
cons: At OCBC Securities, pay increment is pathetic and insincere. No noticeable talent retention efforts. non- finance functional training is hardly available and external conferences need to be justified.

review_title: A good place for career development for those with the right attitude and aptitude
job_title: Assistant Vice President in Kuala Lumpur
pros: The organization culture promotes learning and growth. There's opportunity for career advancement for those with the passion to work for it. The most important thing in the workplace is the people and environment which I think OCBC has the right people and good environment.
cons: Disparity in salary and benefits between executive staff with non-executive staff. Benefits wise, OCBC is not the best among other financial institution.

pros:
Managers respect hard work, nice colleagues, and very nice working environment.
Great teammates, nice location and easy to get to the office with public transportation.
cons: Well, it is an internship, so I didn't expect very much but I got a lot from the experience.

review_title: Unfair comparison and poor compensation package
pros:
Some senior managements are willing to impact knowledge
People are generally nice and helpful at the ground level
cons:
Promotion is based on 1. budget, 2. seniority, 3. performance, people have to "queue" up year on year to get promoted if you are not management's favourite. 
The typical mentality of "cheap" and "good", want hardworking employee but give lousy pay.
Senior management politics and warfare.

pros: Have oppportunity of internal transfer(I transfer from branch to HQ). Great explosure to different superiors of different ways of management.  Encounter HQ team leader lack of leading and grooming talent experience but the senior leader in branch is great and concern your career progression.
cons: One of the HQ leader not supportive, poor communication & not respect toward staff by simply changed your position whithout your agreement.

pros: great employees, friendly work culture. workflow was organised and everybody had very clearly defined roles. good facilities (if you have time to use them)
cons: long working hours, low compensation and mundane work. all i did was sorting and data entry although i felt like i could do more. lack of opportunity for rotation

pros: Good working environment and many opportunities for internal job transfers. Strong senior management providing good direction for the Bank. Flexi benefits and above average EPF rate. Also provides better rates for staff for FD and loans.
cons: Not much work life balance, a lot of changes as Bank moving towards big data. As it is a Bank, there is a lot of governance and compliance. Still a lot of manual workaround for work.

review_title: Great environment for people focused on family
pros: Good employer on the whole, general welfare would depend on department joined. Good leave benefits for maternity, marriage. Training is not bad with a learning academy.
cons: Salary scale usually below market. I have known of individuals who have stayed in the Bank for more than 20 years and promotion is based on tenor of service and not on merit.

pros:
Great learning opportunity, good networking.

Good place to develop basic knowledge of industry for future jobs.  

Energetic working environment, cohesive teams.
cons: Pays too low in comparison to foreign banks (US / Euro), overly conservative in risk management (good and bad obviously).

pros: people were really friendly and helpful especiall if you require any assistance in clarifying your doubts, they will try to take time off to assist you
cons: the working hours are really long. because it's flexible meaning people are allowed to work for longer hours in order to finish their task.

job_title: Team Manager Mortgage in Kuala Lumpur
pros:
1. Great benefits like AL medical loans claims
2. Result oriented so promotions were easy if you perform
3. Great training given, on and off within the year two. When u first join... 2weeks of training all day.
cons: 1. Hard to progress from sales to non sales roles

review_title: Focus on acquiring Premier Customer and offer professional wealth advisory solutions based on client needs.
pros: The working ethic is excellent and the fast track program is quite interesting. Besides that, the company also strongly emphasize on compliance and customer fair dealing.
cons: Too conservative in terms of taking risk for better returns. And the pay is consider low compare to peer industry.

job_title: Relationship Manager in Puchong New Village
pros: You get to learn a lot of banking knowledge as a beginning stage as the bank really put a lot of effort to teach every single one of the staff.
cons: Too stress. As the industry is facing a challenging moment, the bank will utilize all the human capital in the bank to produce more productivity resulting 1 sales staff will need to sell too many products.

pros: A fun place to work in. Interaction between people are abundant and it promotes cohesiveness of the organisation as a whole
cons: The remuneration package offered is not as good of other foreign banks. This would also apply to personal advancement as well

pros: Good staff benefits like OT claims, minimum 19 days annual leave, medical and hospitalisation benefits. Friendly colleagues.
cons: Long working hours. No work-life balance. Superiors not communicative with staffs.

review_title: Interned at OCBC for a few months
pros: Strong bank, great location, interesting employee perks. The bank is doing well and treats its employees well. There is a wide range of job functions, friendly colleagues.
cons: working hours are long and the hierarchy is very rigid. The working culture is also very stiff in a sense that there is not much room for personalization, creativity etc.

job_title: Personal Financial Advisor in Petaling Jaya
pros: Fun people and challenging. Good start if you have no experience in job market because you can learn on the way
cons: Insurance sales basically . Very pushy in product sales and pays lower than market average for salary . Commission is held back and rewarded based on customer service

pros: Good benefit and helpful colleague.
cons: I have been working for 5 years in the same position. There is always empty promises from the manager and higher management on promotions,  bonuses etc.. They only care for sales staff but not the support staff. Sacrifices and hardwork does not pay off at this company as a support staff.

pros:
-Bloomberg named OCBC as the world's strongest bank recently, adding value to brand name
-perceived as a "foreign bank"/chinaman bank in malaysia, therefore there's some respect to the name
-good training programs, in house
cons:
-no knowledge sharing
-no recognition
-egotistical workers, most of them low quality
-worships anyone from citibank, most of senior management are stolen from citibank

pros: It has a strong governance of structured processes with clear guideline. Very process oriented and strong compliance to the regulatory body.
cons: An environment that is very rigid to flexibility or open to adopt an open concept of working culture. Technology are still very outdated as openess are always associated with risk.

review_title: Local run organization focusing on employee's learning and development
pros:
Good environment for learning, development. 
Organization culture is one of the best in the banking industry.
cons: Minority of the old school managerial staffs adopt micro-managed style, which might dampen the staffs morale and performance.

pros: A good place to learn, good managers, good benefits, flexible leave plan, many volunteer programs, willing to fund employees' further education.
cons: Depending on where you are and which team you work for, management sometimes is not engaging and employee satisfaction survey can be manipulated. However OCBC Group is quite big so this does not speak for all managers.

pros:
more exposure and  colleagues are very nice and kind. team bond closely to each other.
It is stable among the local banks.
cons: As a local bank, one of the downsides is is locality. Foreigner is not that easy to adapy into the company.

job_title: Young Banker Trainee in Kuala Lumpur
pros: The regional training week was the best part of the management trainee programme. Can't wait for it to develop more
cons: Long hours of work everyday as per usual in Asia and large traditional conservative corporations

pros: They apply very strict bank facility security measure. The culture is friendly and professional. The human management was strict and departmental.
cons: I have not learnt enough to comment on many negative sides of working at OCBC bank. It is also inappropriate for me to comment in much detail of how the bank works.

pros:
high salary for fresh graduate
can learn banking information but not in deep
colleague is good
cons:
definitely an oversea china culture company
work like a robot which just follow the instruction give by manager
no corporate between department

job_title: Assistant Vice President in Kuala Lumpur
pros: Staffs are allowed to apply for transfer across division in the bank after 2 years of service in current dept
cons: A few bad apples who play favourites caused good employees to leave the bank.

pros: Colleagues were amazing & supportive
cons: Backward culture from senior management. Who i thought were not very educated.

review_title: Is a Singapore Bank in Malaysia
pros: Very Structured, Discipline, Compliant, medium hierarchy, revenue driven
cons: Dont expect big support from Singapore if your portfolio is not a core function, but dont be surprise with multiple / conflicting direction from division & regional office on top of your head of department

pros: Teams work well together and lots of social life outside of work. A lot of opportunities and scope to perform as an intern.
cons: A lot of sharing between teams and you'll sometimes feel like your role is being stretched! Not always a bad thing though as leaves room for development

pros: Good colleagues, fair compensation and lots of learning opportunities. Forward looking senior management and business is growing at stellar speed
cons: Disparity of job scope evident from multiple interactions at different functional groups and levels. Compensation may not be exactly on par with the rest of the key competitors

pros: Good package, with fixed working hours, not so many ot required. Good for networking to rotate
cons: Rigid, hierachichal structure, its hard to be innovative because you need to follow a quite rigid system

review_title: Overall good but stressful timelines to meet. Besides, compliance makes the work become more tedious.
pros: Good staff benefit, trainings provided with good food served and young colleagues in department with ideas to be shared together
cons:
Stressful timelines......always work late...

Sometimes favourism by supervisor
...those who cn work better will always be assigned the most workload

review_title: Good environment, professional, active and much challenge
job_title: Performance Bonus in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: Have a chance to work and learn from the job. Improve your skills on the teamwork, independent skill, workload, strategy..
cons: Have a very good skill to work independently. Need to be ready at all time and have to strictly following the policies and procedures

pros: Under the right Team, guidance would be provided and Sr Mgmt would take input into consideration
cons: No work life balance and long hours.  Certain revised processes not deem as process improvement but instead, lengthen the turnaround time - waste of time and resource effort.

pros:
Friendly colleagues.
Bosses are open and receptive to feedback. 
Opportunity in abundance. 
Nice emphasis on training.
Great location!
cons:
Highly political environment.
Too much of personal agenda and too little of working towards a common goal.
Red tapes in abundance.
Pretty much a dinosaur.

pros: Earned a bunch of good colleagues. A lot of team bonding activities organized. Overall it is a good environment to work.
cons: Too many strict processes implemented and no work life balance. Infra engineer normally work OT but they are not supposed to claim it.

review_title: Work life balance doesn't exist in this company!
pros: Nothing good to work here as the increment are low no matter how hardworking you are.
cons: Never practice Six Sigma daily which caused them to force their employee to work during weekends when CEO going to visit their branch! Long working hour and expect their employee to work from day to night and from weekday to weekend.

pros: less "political" issue and good benefit
cons: long working hour........experienced 45 days non-stop working (included weekend) and weekday from 8.45-9pm

pros: Good team and supportive manager. Offers good salaries, benefits, and compensation. Clear route for career progression.
cons: High-pressure sales environment. Company relies on outdated or cumbersome systems that significantly reduces productivity.

pros: great benefits and easy to ask for claim
cons:
tense environment
need to work independently because no one is helpinh u even its ur team manager or ur senior
u need to ask permission before go to toilet

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Good place to work at.  Friendly and very nice employees, minus one or two. Pay is in line with the market and the benefits are good.  Good place for recent graduates.
cons: Not many people get promotioned.

job_title: AML Compliance Analyst in Kuala Lumpur
pros: The benefits of the company is very good
cons: Favoritism exist in this company and the senior management does not want to listen to what their staff wants

pros: Flexible hours, good and honest people, lasting friendships. Products are above average with a strong focus on customer-centricity and strong technical development team to drive initiatives forward.
cons: Poor working environment not suited for the younger generation with archaic management techniques

pros: Exposure to a lot of things. Place where you can excel yourself. There are a lot of opportunities if you plan to stay long term
cons: Loads of work, not so much concern on work-life balance

pros: Generally a good experience. You basically need to understand how the departments by taking a lot of initiatives on your own.
cons: It is not a formal graduate programme, you really need to be proactive if you really want to learn something.

review_title: Great working atmosphere, great work-life balance
pros: Friendliest staff, lovely family atmosphere, everyone cares about you and helps everyone else out, a very safe job
cons: Slow career and salary progression

review_title: Young culture and relatively okay benefit
pros: Young culture and relatively okay benefit, opportunity of secondment after 2 years (aka transfer to another department)
cons: typical red taps in the bank, tedious compliance work

pros: Asian bank, therefore, the people in the organization is friendlier.
cons: The compensation is based on relationship (with your bosses) rather than the overall effort you have put in for the company

pros: the benefits were good, training provided.
cons: was in the wrong department, no life, bored job, head was not friendly and kept on forcing the department.

job_title: Assistant Vice President in Kuala Lumpur
pros: Flexi benefit is good but needs to upgraded in comparison to market rate.
cons:
Too afraid of audit.
Silo mentality is very apparent and strong here.
A lot of redundant process and policies that can be improved just by logic.

review_title: Good entry level position to someone looking to experiance SE Asia
pros: Great name to put on a resume.
cons: No chance of advancement within the company.  Job scope is very limited.

pros:
1. Reputable brand.
2. Operations are very process-oriented and clear.
3. Strong management.
cons:
1. Work-life balance can be improved.
2.  Sometimes, certain processes and procedures can be too rigid, and actually impact the  delivery of service.

pros: The career pathway is good but it depends on what kind of position. Salary is quite good but it depends on the corporate ranking. Promotion and increment salary based on the performance.
cons: No work life balance, quite pressure sometimes.

review_title: Too top heavy, no career progression
job_title: Vice President Sales in Kuala Lumpur
pros: Decent working hours and work load, decent health benefits, branding still good
cons: not much career progression for those who has been in the bank for more than 10 years. At times, too much office politics

pros: Good benefits. Training in stages.
cons: No work life balance. Stress to go for work

pros: The involvement in projects, the leadership of senior management
cons: Basically nothing. Everything was great. Really appreciate the opportunity.

review_title: Stable Job but little intellectual challenges (in operations)

Very nice people
Good senior management
Good training

Little room for progression
Too clerical for a young graduate
No sight of future progression/career prospects
Attrition rate is high and competent/experienced staff low

review_title: Tiring and no work life balance

Good benefits
Good  Epf contribution
cons:
Office politics
Promotion, bonuses, increment not depend on your hard work and contribution but depend on your supervisor's influence in management.

pros: High basic pay for fresh grad
cons: None at the moment/ still new to this company

job_title: Assistant Vice President in Kuala Lumpur

review_title: Good culture, more can be done for resource management
pros: People here are amazing, major pull factor here
cons: Headcount vs Work is always mismatched

pros: Nice people, nice building, leading financial institution in Singapore with a lot of investments
cons: Conservative, typically there will a lot of old guys with low education

review_title: Hope it is a good company
pros: Hope it is a good company, with good management.  Hope is a good company with good managment.

review_title: I am as brand ambassador in Indonesia, was given advantages such as: monthly salary, room / office.

review_title: Plain old bank without proper structure
pros: work life balanced, support employee with family
cons: slow in process improvement.  Terrible IT support and resources

pros: Good working environment and nice colleague
cons: Limited career progressment and management is only having preference for management trainee even though they are not ready

pros: Structured training and decent pay
cons: Typical sweat house... If below sales expectation, retooling session, cold call till 9pm... and lecture (scolding) till 12 midnight... focus only on insurance products

pros: people there are nice and good, work load is light and working time is great
cons: the job i did is very boring, i was assigned to do filing only for an internship

pros: Relatively flat hierarchy, direct relationship with top management, relationship with management considerably personal
cons: Can be seen as old school in some areas, sticky to change.

pros:
Good employee benefits
Friendly working environment
Positive learning curve

review_title: Conservative company with a drive for Productivity

Internal opportunities to try different roles and emphasis on training
Good colleagues
cons: Work life balance and expectation employees to be available even while on holidays

review_title: Marcom Professional with proven track records on advertising, public relations, brand awareness and promotion

pros:

pros: Extensive Training & Career Advancement & top performer deserve the well reward & Advance System & leave entitlement

pros: Nice people very friendly , and working with passion .

review_title: great its nice to have a job
job_title: Manager of Chief Executive Officer in Thunder Bay, ON
pros: HR pays out of the bank in cash

pros: Great staff and very hardworking
